contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=December 2007}} {{Infobox mountain range <!-- *** Name section *** --> | name = Great Western Tiers | native_name = | other_name = | other_name1 = <!-- *** Image *** --> | photo = GreatWesternTiers.jpg | photo_size = | photo_caption = Great Western Tiers From Chudleigh <!-- *** Etymology *** ---> | etymology = <!-- *** Country etc. *** --> | country = [[Australia]] | state = [[Tasmania]] | region = [[Central Highlands (Tasmania)|Central Highlands]] | region1 = | district = | district1 = <!-- *** Orography *** --> | border = | border1 = | geology = | geology1 = | period = | period1 = | orogeny = | orogeny1 = <!-- *** Geography *** --> | area_km2 = | length_km = | length_orientation = | length_round = | width_km = | width_orientation = | width_round = | highest = | highest_name =Ironstone Mountain | elevation_m =1444 | lat_d = | lat_m = | lat_s = | lat_NS = | long_d = | long_m = | long_s = | long_EW = | range_lat_d=41|range_lat_m=45|range_lat_NS=S | range_long_d=146|range_long_m=35|range_long_EW=E | region_code=AU <!-- *** Map section *** --> | map = | map_size = | map_caption = | map_first = }} The '''Great Western Tiers''' are a collection of small mountain [[Cliff|bluffs]] in the northern part of the [[Tasmania]]n [[Central Highlands (Tasmania)|Central Highlands]]. They stretch from [[Western Bluff]], near the town of [[Mole Creek, Tasmania|Mole Creek]], towards the east, passing south of the town of [[Meander, Tasmania|Meander]], north of the [[Great Lake (Tasmania)|Great Lake]], and ending at [[Millers Bluff]], approximately 25 km west of [[Campbell Town, Tasmania|Campbell Town]], near the [[Macquarie River (Tasmania)|Macquarie River]]. The highest of the peaks is [[Ironstone Mountain]], at 1,444m. The Tiers form the border between the fertile valleys of eastern Tasmania, and the high, rocky, sparsely inhabited and infertile Central Plateaux. The lend their name to the '''Great Western Tiers''' tourist route, signposted along the [[Bass Highway (Tasmania)|Bass Highway]]. [[Image:GreatWesternTiersFromChudleigh.jpg|thumb|none|400px|[[Panorama]] from the [[Chudleigh, Tasmania|Chudleigh]] of The Great Western Tiers]] == Peaks == The following [[Summit (topography)|peaks]] and [[hill|bluffs]] belong to the Great Western Tiers: [[Ironstone Mountain]], [[Mother Cummings Peak]], [[Neals Bluff]], [[Panorama Hill]], [[Mount Parmeener]], [[Western Bluff]] [[Category:Central Highlands (Tasmania)]] [[Category:Mountains of Tasmania]] {{Tasmania-geo-stub}}
